snippet: President Obama said he refused to engage again in the sort of brinkmanship that brought the country close to default last year and damaged its credit rating.
abstract: Pres Obama, who in effect campaigned against corporate America, is trying to rebuild relations with business community in hopes of enlisting it in his showdown with Republicans in Congress over looming fiscal crisis.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman contributed reporting from Washington, and Nelson D. Schwartz from New York.

lead_paragraph: President Obama said he refused to engage again in the sort of brinkmanship that brought the country close to default last year and damaged its credit rating.

headline.seo: Obama Tells G.O.P. Not to Tie Debt Ceiling to Fiscal Debate
headline.main: Obama Appeals to Business for Support on Tax Plan
headline.print_headline: Obama Appeals to Business for Support on Tax Plan
